page.title: 08Churches in Bawtry
page.content: There is a Methodist Chapel prominently situated near the centre of the town while the Parish Church of St. Nicholas is reached from Wharf Street. The tower of the church has a castle-like turret and the upper part is built of white stone but has no bell.The building has an untidy appearance and sections have been added,with the use of different types of stone very apparent.The surrounding graveyard is enclosed by iron railings and overgrown with candytuft. Some of graves date back to the 18th.Century. The Methodist Church has no graveyard and is surrounded by modern buildings. The Pinfold is to be found next to it. The church is an imposing building with black irion railings. The stained glass is in the art nouveau style with pale green,pink,mauve and yellow panes in flower and leaf shapes.
